message.content:
We start by recognizing that the carrying amount of inventories sold is typically represented by the cost of goods sold (COGS) from the income statement. In the example provided, although the cash flow statement shows the change in inventory (which represents the movement of the balance sheet item), the value we need is taken from the income statement line item "Cost of Goods Sold."

Reviewing the income statement in the current problem:
â€¢ Cost of Goods Sold: 4680000.00

Thus, the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period is 4680000.00.

```json
{"solution": {"value": "4680000.00"}}
```
